definition[0]: to go past a moving vehicle or person because you are going faster than them and want to get in front of them
example[0]: He pulled out to overtake the van.
example[1]: Never try to overtake on a bend.
definition[1]: to develop or increase more quickly than someone or something else and become more successful, more important, or more advanced than them
example[2]: Television soon overtook the cinema as the most popular form of entertainment.
example[3]: Hingis has now overtaken her in the world tennis rankings.
definition[2]: if something bad, especially a feeling, overtakes you, it happens to you suddenly and has a strong effect on you
example[4]: A terrible sense of panic overtook him.
example[5]: She was overtaken by emotion and started to cry.
